instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3_OUT: What is PPVRTC_G3_OUT? PPVRTC_G3_OUT is a 3.3v power line that comes out of the clock chip. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for ‚ÄúPP5V_S0‚Äù.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> high fan spin
threads.message:
There is green light and turns to amber
The fan spins very fast and the CPU is not getting hot  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.61 
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>=3.420
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3_OUT</SIGNAL>=3.2
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>=5.0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> high fan spin
threads.message:
Fan shouldn't spin untill CPU gets hot.
If starts with max speed, some SMC sensor is triggered.

Test known good trackpad flex/board first.
Also try disconnecting webcam.

threads.message: I tested the board only on the bench without connecting anything the fan starts in max speed

threads.message:
Any big coil gets voltage?
What about <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS, <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> high fan spin
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL>=0.350v"
Fix the problem.
Check diode mode to ground first.
If good, check <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> high fan spin
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8030</CHIP> is looks so ugly some pads are burnt I've fixed it the system now works fine üòä 
Thanks
